original_text:
PACCM Attending Progress Note
**INSTITUTION
Patient :
**NAME[AAA , BBB] H
MRN - **ID-NUM - MPACCOMMMRN
Age :
**AGE[in 60s] years
Sex :
Male
DOB :
**DATE[Dec 22 1937]
Author :
**NAME[XXX , WWW]
Assessment
I am managing this patient 's care in the MICU today at the request of Dr. **NAME[VVV] for acute respiratory failure secondary to cardiogenic pulmonary edema with underlying COPD .
Required intubation and mechanical vent support for severe acute on chronic hypercapnia .
CXR with bilateral alveolar infiltrates .
PMH sig for COPD , CHF obesity , OSA , chronic hypercapnia , atrial fibrillation
Problem list
All Problems
ACUTE RESPIRATORY FAILURE ( ICD - 9 - CM 518.81 )
CHF [Congestive heart failure] ( ICD - 9 - CM 428.0 )
COPD [Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease] ( ICD - 9 - CM 496 )
ATRIAL FIBRILLATION ( ICD - 9 - CM 427.31 )
Subjective
The patient has required continued ventilator support overnight .
Objective
General Appearance : lethargic on vent  .
Chest : copious volume secretions , purulent color , symmetric aeration , rhonchi on auscultation .
Cardiac : normal blood pressure , irregular rhythm , atrial fbrillation / flutter , Sounds .
Abdomen : obese , Palpation , hypoactive bowel sounds .
Extremities : cool , delayed capillary refill , symmetric lower extremity edema .
Neurologic : lethargic , normal motor exam .
Integument : ecchymoses , pale  .
Medications
Labs :
I have reviewed all the laboratory data today :
Results
**DATE[Apr 26 2007] 11:45 AM
Na 144 mEq / L
K 4.3 mEq / L
Cl 101 mEq / L
CO2 45 mEq / L High
Anion Gap - 2.0 Low
BUN 24 mg / dL
Cr 1.1 mg / dL
Glucose 136 mg / dL High
Ca 9.4 mg / dL
Troponin I 0.07 ng / mL
WBC 9.9 X10E+09 / L
RBC 3.50 X10E+12 / L Low
Hgb 10.8 gm / dL Low
Hct 33.5 % Low
MCV 95.5 fL
MCH 30.7 pg
MCHC 32.1 gm / dL Low
RDW 15.6 % High
MPV 7.8 fL
Platelets 252 X10E+09 / L
Neutrophils 84 %
Lymphs 7 % Low
Monocytes 9 %
Eosinophils 0 %
Basophils 0 %
ABS Neutrophils 8.3 X10E+09 / L
ABS Lymphs 0.6 X10E+09 / L
ABS Monocytes 0.9 X10E+09 / L
Abs Eos , auto 0.0 X10E+09 / L
ABS Basophils 0.0 X10E+09 / L
PT 18.9 sec High
INR 1.6 High
B-Type Natriuretic Peptide 868 pg / mL High
**DATE[Apr 26 2007] 11:30 AM
Total CO2 Content 50.2 mMol / L High
pHa 7.24 Low
PaCO2 113.0 mmHg Critical High
PaO2 172.0 mmHg High
HCO3a 46.8 mMol / L High
Base Excess , Arterial 15.8 mMol / L High
O2 Content , Arterial 15.3 Vol % Low
% O2 Saturation 99.4 % High
Oxy Hgb ( Arterial ) 98.1 % High
Methemoglobin 0.4 %
CO _ 0.9 %
% Reduced Hemoglobin 0.6 %
Crit. Value Called To x / readbac
DR **NAME[UUU]
Critical Value called by : S CARLBERG
Allens Test Passed
Oxygen Device Face Tent
Liters Per Minute 6
Na , Whole Blood 147 mMol / L High
K , Whole Blood 4.1 mMol / L
Ionized Ca , Whole Blood 1.25 mMol / L High
Total Hemoglobin 10.8 gm / dL Low
My own interpretation of the chest radiograph is The radiograph shows a bilateral alveolar infiltrate .
The patient 's radiograph demonstrates cardiomegaly .
ETT noted  .
Assessment :
My management of this critically ill patient in the MICU today has included the following :
Respiratory :
The patient has clinical findings consistent with an aspiration pneumonia , The patient 's current ventilator parameters are acceptable .
I will not proceed with weaning today until the patient is more alert and cooperative .
Clinical picture c/w CHF and pneumonia .
q 4hr nebs with duoneb and pulmicort .
Hold on systemic corticosteroids .
Check CXR in AM , repeat ABG .
Given frequency of bouts of respiratory failure will need to strongly consider trach for long term manangent  .
Cardiovascular :
Pulmonary edema .
Follow enzymes , ECG with with T wave inversions precordial leads .
Cardiogy consult .
IV heparin , ASA  .
Renal / Electrolytes :
The patient has renal function within acceptable limits at this time .
GI / Nutrition :
The patient 's abdominal exam is currently within acceptable limits , The patient 's evaluation suggests normal GI function .
I will initiate feeding within the next 24 hours if we do not progress to extubation .
Infectious Disease :
Severe community acquired pneumonia with copious thick discolored secretions .
Begin empiric antibiotics with vanco , cefepime , zithro , panculture .
MRSA isolation .
Neurology :
The patient has evidence for a metabolic encephalopathy , severe hypercapnia contributing to obtundation  .
Endocrine :
Diagnosis , The patient 's recent blood sugar results were reviewed and I have revised the insulin coverage .
Hematology :
Anemia eval  .
Psychosocial :
I have reviewed the patient 's advance directive
The patient is to continue as full support .
Disposition :
The patient requires ongoing monitoring in the MICU today .
I have spent 55 minutes of critical care time managing and monitoring this patient 's care at the bedside today .
This is exclusive of any time for procedures or my teaching time
Professional Services Credentials and Title of Author **NAME[TTT] Signing this Document : **NAME[SSS] : MD
Titles : Attending
Perform by **NAME[XXX , WWW]
( on **DATE[Apr 26 2007] 14:48 )
Sign by **NAME[XXX , WWW]
( on **DATE[Apr 26 2007] 14:48 )
VERIFY by **NAME[XXX , WWW]
( on **DATE[Apr 26 2007] 14:48 )
